name: "Supergirl" Season 2 Episode 22 Trivia Game | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who attacked Supergirl in the opening scene?
questions.explanation:
Superman.

	In a carryover from the end of the previous episode Superman attacked her. He was under some type of control and thought she was trying to harm the people of Earth instead of saving them. The two fought it out on Rhea's ship.

questions.text: What color Kryptonite made its series debut in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Silver.

	Silver Kryptonite made Superman see Kara as Zod, and hear her words as if Zod was threatening to attack. Rhea used the Silver K to control Superman, and keep Supergirl from stopping her plans.

questions.text: What game was Lena playing when Lillian walked in on her?
questions.explanation:
Chess.

	She told Lena that the chess board had been in the Luthor family for generations. They then had a heated discussion on how Lillian had been a bad mother for years. Lillian then said she had maybe backed the wrong child and asked for help ridding the world of Supergirl.

questions.text: Who challenged Rhea to a duel?
questions.explanation:
Supergirl.

	It was an ancient Daxam tradition that required a fight to the death. If Supergirl won the fight she could make the invasion end, if Rhea won, there would be no one to attempt to stop her. Kara was the champion of earth because she had beaten Superman in the fight earlier in the episode.

J'onn.

	M'gann appeared to him in his dream/coma and asked him to wake up and help his friends. He bolted up and demanded to see her, and was told that she was still on Mars. He returned to the DEO and helped to prepare Supergirl for her fight with Rhea.

questions.text: What movie did Cat Grant claim to have never seen?
questions.explanation:
Star Wars.

	The inside joke to fans is that the Calista Flockhart, who plays Kat Grant, is married to "Star Wars" star Harrison Ford. She made a reference to Darth Vader and lightsabers, but got the references wrong, only to be corrected by Kara.

questions.text: Mon-El was the only Daxamite who could live on Earth if Lena used her device.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The device would put small doses of lead into the air, not noticeable to humans, but deadly to those from Daxam. Mon-El, being exposed to Earth's sun longer could stay a bit longer than the others, but he too would have to leave or die. Supergirl said they'd use the device only as a last resort.

questions.text: Where did Rhea and her opponent meet to do battle?
questions.explanation:
On a rooftop.

	During the fight Rhea ordered her fleet to destroy the city. Mon-El, Martian Manhunter and Superman went to fight the fleet while Supergirl took on Rhea. M'gann and some white Martians also showed up to help with the fight. Rhea used every trick she could to try to win, including showing off her Kryptonite poisoning in her blood as a way to deter Supergirl from trying to fight. In the end Supergirl won only because she used the device.

questions.text: The Flash and Green Arrow showed up to help fight the invaders.
questions.explanation:
False.

	While there were several crossovers to the other DC Television series, no characters from the other shows appeared in the season finale. Supergirl and her friends won the battle on their own.

questions.text: Who got a marriage proposal near the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Maggie.

	Alex proposed to Maggie near the end of the episode. She had a talk with Kara, and int he next scene popped the question to her girlfriend. Cat also talked about marriage, mentioning she'd done it four times, but had no onscreen boyfriend to speak of.
